links.*: The Lost Road and Other Writings

wikitext.*:
'''PIK''' is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] without any given signification, except for what can be determined from its derivatives.<ref name=LR>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 382 (root appearing as "PIK-")</ref>

Before arriving at the form PIK, [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] experimented with the form PEK.<ref>{{VT|46a}}, p. 10 (root appearing as "PEK-")</ref>

==Derivatives==

*[[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]]: ''pika'' ("small spot, dot")<ref name=LR/>
**[[Noldorin]]: ''peg'' ("small spot, dot")<ref name=LR/>
*[[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]]: ''pikina'' ("tiny")<ref name=LR/>
**[[Noldorin]]: ''pigen'' ("tiny")<ref name=LR/>

==See also==

*[[PEYE]]
